You make a good point. Unfortunately, throughout history, people have often faced discrimination and persecution because of their religious beliefs, and Augustine's experiences were no exception. It is certainly unfortunate that his former colleagues felt threatened by his conversion to Christianity, and it is important to remember that everyone has the right to freedom of religion and the freedom to choose their own beliefs.

Despite the opposition Augustine faced, he remained steadfast in his faith and continued to pursue his beliefs through his writing and teachings. His influence on Christianity and Western philosophy is incalculable, and his contributions to our understanding of faith, morality, and the human condition continue to be studied and discussed today.

In the end, Augustine's commitment to his faith served as a powerful example of the importance of standing up for what we believe in, even in the face of opposition and criticism.
